result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Room w/in Building, etc., a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(f).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber. Sentence credit of 20 days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be determined at future hearing.
12-19-14 PER HEARING, RESTITUTION SET TO ZERO.
Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

No Contact with the victim. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard A Miller in court with Attorney Nicole M. Masnica.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Masnica makes statements regarding sentencing and states they request a restitution hearing based on state's restitution request.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:

7 MONTHS HUBER  (CREDIT 20 DAYS, IF REVOKED)

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with:  victim
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant
 
  Restitution hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on October 30, 2014 at 11:00 am.
